thread.title: Flooding closes local road in Lower Hutt
thread.title_full: Flooding closes local road in Lower Hutt

title: Flooding closes local road in Lower Hutt
text:
Flooding closes local road in Lower Hutt Last updated 22:15, February 2 2017 Supplied 
A car succumbs to the flooding on Block Rd, Lower Hutt. 
A car has been spotted fully submerged in water on a Lower Hutt road after flash flooding. 
The surface flooding has closed Block Rd in Lower Hutt, north of Wellington, on Thursday evening. 
The local road was shut down shortly after 9:30pm as the lower North Island experienced heavy rain. Supplied 
The road is notorious for flash floods. 
The New Zealand Transport Agency said it will be closed until further notice, however State Highway 2 would remain open. 
MetService have said the rain should ease overnight, and early Friday morning.
